title: (x) Buick font mystery solved - Somerset {Mark S}
content: It's probably too late now, but I found the mystery font from Anika Qureshi's second sample [in this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071109/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/34158.html)--the one that says "Riviera. Developing its...". It's an old Headliners face called Somerset. Not available digitally. [Treacyfaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071109/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/) owns the design now. Perhaps Joe will digitize it one of these days.
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content:
It's never too late to nail an ID. Thorough as ever, Mark Kent ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071109im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif),   
but not exactly faster than a speeding bullet. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071109im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)

Well, I had given up on it. It caught my eye yesterday when I was trying to find something else in the Headliners book (that tauntingly familar-looking [Ghostbusters](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071109/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35876.html?1084691411) font) and I remembered the Buick thread.
